name: roboRIO
description: The robot's onboard computer, it uses preprogrammed instructions to direct the various components of the robot on how to move.

name: Battery
description: Provides power for the robot's electronics.

name: Main Breaker
description: Acts as the power cutoff switch for the entire robot.

name: Power Distribution Panel
description: Receives power from the battery and distributes it among the different robot components with differing voltages.

name: Pneumatic Control Module
description: Manages the pneumatics system

name: Signal light
description: Uses solid and pulsing light sequences to signal the status of the robot.

name: CIM
description: Converts (electrical) potential energy into mechanical energy. This specific motor provides a very powerful output.

name: Servo
description: Reads directly from a PWM signal to turn to a specific angle.

name: Window motor
description: Relatively weak motor that normally runs the power windows in a car. It is usually used for low-load applications.

name: Victor
description: Receives a PWM signal and translates it into a voltage for the attached motor to use.

name: Jaguar
description: Receives a PWM or CAN signal and translates it into a voltage for the attached motor to use.

name: Talon
description: Receives a PWM signal and translates it into a voltage for the attached motor to use.

name: Spike
description: Acts as a light switch to turn power to a motor/light on, off, or reverse it.

name: Compressor
description: Charges the pneumatic storage tanks for use by the pneumatics system.

name: Solenoid
description: Uses an electromagnet to drive a valve to actuate a pneumatic system.

name: Potentiometer
description: Translates rotation into a resistance, and, in turn, a voltage. Translated into a digital value by the roboRIO.

name: Limit switch
description: A simple switch that senses on and off states.

name: Gyro
description: Measures orientation along the X, Y, and Z axes

name: Encoder
description: Records distance/rotation as digital pulses.

name: Gear tooth sensor
description: Uses the hall effect to count the number of gear teeth that pass by in a given period of time.

name: Pressure switch
description: Detects when the pressure is reaches a certain threshold (usually 115 psi)

name: Game controller
description: Gathers user input to control the robot.

name: Radio
description: Manages the communications between the roboRIO and the driver station, over wired ethernet or wireless.
